020package com.bewsoftware.utils;
021
022import com.bewsoftware.utils.struct.Ref;
023import java.util.*;
024
025/**
026 * This is a Binary Search Tree with the default capability of being a Balanced
027 * Binary Search Tree.
028 * <p>
029 * This class does not support storage of either {@code null}s or duplicates.
030 *
031 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
032 * @param <E> type of item stored in this tree.
033 *
034 * @since 1.0.9
035 * @version 2.1.0
036 */
037public final class AvlTree<E extends Comparable<E>> implements Set<E>
038{
039
040    /**
041     * No nulls allowed string.
042     */
043    private static final String NO_NULLS = "This class does not support storage of 'null's";
044
045    /**
046     * A value indicating whether this {@linkplain  AvlTree}{@literal <T>} is
047     * balanced.
048     */
049    private boolean balanced;
050
051    /**
052     * The number of elements in this tree.
053     */
054    private int count;
055
056    /**
057     * The version of data last indexed.
058     */
059    private int lastIndexVersion;
060
061    /**
062     * The root node.
063     */
064    private Node<E> root;
065
066    /**
067     * The version of the data.
068     */
069    private int version;
070
071    /**
072     * Initializes a new instance of the {@linkplain  AvlTree}{@literal <E>}
073     * class as a
074     * Balanced Binary Search Tree.
075     */
076    public AvlTree()
077    {
078        balanced = true;
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Initializes a new instance of the {@linkplain  AvlTree}{@literal <E>}
083     * class as a
084     * Binary Search Tree that will/will not be balanced based on the value of
085     * the
086     * parameter: {@code balanced}.
087     *
088     * @param balanced if {@code true} tree will be balanced
089     */
090    public AvlTree(boolean balanced)
091    {
092        this.balanced = balanced;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Initializes a new instance of the {@linkplain  AvlTree}{@literal <E>}
097     * class with the contents
098     * of the {@code list} as a Balanced Binary Search Tree.
099     *
100     * @param list the list containing the items to add to this tree
101     */
102    public AvlTree(List<E> list)
103    {
104        this(list, true);
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Initializes a new instance of the {@linkplain  AvlTree}{@literal <E>}
109     * class, as a
110     * Binary Search Tree that will/will not be balanced based on the value of
111     * the
112     * parameter: {@code balanced}, with the contents of the {@code list}.
113     *
114     * @param list     the list containing the items to add to this tree
115     * @param balanced if {@code true} tree will be balanced
116     */
117    public AvlTree(List<E> list, boolean balanced)
118    {
119        if (list == null)
120        {
121            throw new IllegalArgumentException("list: must not be 'null'");
122        }
123
124        if (!list.isEmpty())
125        {
126            list.forEach(this::internalAdd);
127        }
128
129        this.balanced = balanced;
130    }
131
132    @Override
133    public boolean add(E e)
134    {
135        return internalAdd(e);
136    }
137
138    @Override
139    public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> c)
140    {
141        boolean rtn = false;
142
143        if (!Objects.requireNonNull(c).isEmpty())
144        {
145            c.forEach(this::internalAdd);
146            rtn = true;
147        }
148
149        return rtn;
150    }
151
152    @Override
153    public void clear()
154    {
155        root = null;
156        count = 0;
157        version++;
158    }
159
160    @Override
161    public boolean contains(Object o)
162    {
163        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
164        E item = (E) Objects.requireNonNull(o, NO_NULLS);
165        return find(item) != null;
166    }
167
168    @Override
169    @SuppressWarnings("element-type-mismatch")
170    public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c)
171    {
172        boolean rtn = false;
173
174        for (Object object : Objects.requireNonNull(c))
175        {
176            rtn = contains(object);
177        }
178
179        return rtn;
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Delete the {@code target} from the tree.
184     *
185     * @param target the element to delete
186     *
187     * @return {@code true} unless {@code target} is {@code null}, or
188     *         {@code target} is not found.
189     */
190    public boolean delete(E target)
191    {
192        Ref<Boolean> rtn = Ref.val(false);
193
194        if (target != null)
195        {
196            root = deleteNode(root, target, rtn, balanced);
197
198            if (rtn.val)
199            {
200                count--;
201                version++;
202            }
203        }
204
205        return rtn.val;
206    }
207
208    /**
209     * Returns an iterator over the elements in this set, in descending order.
210     * Equivalent in effect to {@code descendingSet().iterator()}.
211     *
212     * @return an iterator over the elements in this set, in descending order
213     */
214    public Iterator<E> descendingIterator()
215    {
216        reIndex();
217        return new ATDescItor<>();
218    }
219
220    /**
221     * Display the data items in order.
222     */
223    public void display()
224    {
225        if (root == null)
226        {
227            System.out.println("Tree is empty");
228            return;
229        }
230
231        System.out.println(displayInOrder(root));
232    }
233
234    /**
235     * Returns the element at the specified position in this list.
236     *
237     * @param index index of the element to return
238     *
239     * @return the element at the specified position in this list
240     *
241     * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
242     *                                   (index {@literal < 0 || index >= } size())
243     */
244    //    @Override
245    public E get(int index)
246    {
247        Node<E> rtn = getNodeAt(index);
248        return rtn != null ? rtn.Value : null;
249    }
250
251    /**
252     * Returns the index of the specified element in this list, or -1 if this
253     * list does
254     * not contain the element.
255     *
256     * @param o element to search for
257     *
258     * @return the index of the specified element in this list, or -1 if this
259     *         list does
260     *         not contain the element
261     *
262     * @throws ClassCastException   if the type of the specified element is
263     *                              incompatible with this list
264     * @throws NullPointerException if the specified element is null as this
265     *                              list does <b>not</b> permit null
266     *                              elements
267     */
268    //    @Override
269    public int indexOf(Object o)
270    {
271        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
272        E item = (E) o;
273        reIndex();
274        Node<E> node = find(item);
275        return node != null ? node.Index : -1;
276    }
277
278    /**
279     * Gets a value indicating whether this {@linkplain  AvlTree}{@literal <T>}
280     * is balanced.
281     *
282     * @return {@code true } if balanced, {@code false } otherwise
283     */
284    public boolean isBalanced()
285    {
286        return balanced;
287    }
288
289    @Override
290    public boolean isEmpty()
291    {
292        return count == 0;
293    }
294
295    @Override
296    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
297    public Iterator<E> iterator()
298    {
299        reIndex();
300        return new ATItor<>();
301    }
302
303    @Override
304    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
305    public boolean remove(Object o)
306    {
307        if (o == null)
308        {
309            throw new NullPointerException(NO_NULLS);
310        }
311
312        return delete((E) o);
313    }
314
315    @Override
316    @SuppressWarnings("element-type-mismatch")
317    public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c)
318    {
319        //
320        // Original code copied from: java.util.AbstractCollection
321        //
322        Objects.requireNonNull(c);
323        boolean modified = false;
324
325        if (size() > c.size())
326        {
327            modified = c.stream().map(this::remove).reduce(modified, (accumulator, item) -> accumulator | item);
328        } else
329        {
330            for (Iterator<?> i = iterator(); i.hasNext();)
331            {
332                if (c.contains(i.next()))
333                {
334                    i.remove();
335                    modified = true;
336                }
337            }
338        }
339
340        return modified;
341    }
342
343    @Override
344    public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c)
345    {
346        //
347        // Code copied from: java.util.AbstractCollection
348        //
349        Objects.requireNonNull(c);
350        boolean modified = false;
351        Iterator<E> it = descendingIterator();
352
353        while (it.hasNext())
354        {
355            if (!c.contains(it.next()))
356            {
357                it.remove();
358                modified = true;
359            }
360        }
361
362        return modified;
363    }
364
365    @Override
366    public int size()
367    {
368        return count > Integer.MAX_VALUE ? Integer.MAX_VALUE : count;
369    }
370
371    @Override
372    public Object[] toArray()
373    {
374        Object[] rtn = new Object[count];
375        Ref<Integer> index = Ref.val(0);
376
377        fillArray(root, rtn, index);
378
379        return rtn;
380    }
381
382    @Override
383    @SuppressWarnings(
384            {
385                "unchecked", "AssignmentToMethodParameter"
386            })
387    public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a)
388    {
389        // Code from LinkedList class, with some mods
390        if (a.length < count)
391        {
392            a = (T[]) java.lang.reflect.Array.newInstance(
393                    a.getClass().getComponentType(), count);
394        }
395
396        Ref<Integer> index = Ref.val(0);
397        fillArray(root, a, index);
398
399        for (int i = count; i < a.length; i++)
400        {
401            a[i] = null;
402        }
403
404        return a;
405    }
406
407    @Override
408    public String toString()
409    {
410        return "AvlTree{\n"
411                + "  balanced = " + balanced + ",\n"
412                + "  count = " + count + ",\n"
413                + "  lastIndexVersion = " + lastIndexVersion + ",\n"
414                + "  version = " + version + "\n"
415                + "\n"
416                + displayInOrder(root)
417                + "\n}";
418    }
419
420    /**
421     * Recursively search for the correct node to add the new node to.
422     *
423     * @param current the current Node
424     * @param node    the node to add
425     * @param added   {@code true } if successful, {@code false } if already
426     *                exists
427     *
428     * @return replacement parent node
429     */
430    @SuppressWarnings("AssignmentToMethodParameter")
431    private Node<E> addRecursive(Node<E> current, Node<E> node, Ref<Boolean> added)
432    {
433        if (current == null)
434        {
435            current = node;
436            added.val = true;
437
438        } else if (node.Value.compareTo(current.Value) < 0)
439        {
440            current.Left = addRecursive(current.Left, node, added);
441
442        } else if (node.Value.compareTo(current.Value) > 0)
443        {
444            current.Right = addRecursive(current.Right, node, added);
445        }
446
447        if (balanced && added.val)
448        {
449            current = balanceTree(current);
450        }
451
452        return current;
453    }
454
455    /**
456     * The balance factor of this part of the tree.
457     *
458     * @param current the current Node.
459     *
460     * @return the balance factor
461     */
462    private int balanceFactor(Node<E> current)
463    {
464        int l = getHeight(current.Left);
465        int r = getHeight(current.Right);
466
467        return l - r;
468    }
469
470    /**
471     * Method to balance tree after insert or delete.
472     *
473     * @param current the Node whose sub-tree is to be balanced
474     *
475     * @return the replacement parent Node
476     */
477    @SuppressWarnings("AssignmentToMethodParameter")
478    private Node<E> balanceTree(Node<E> current)
479    {
480        int bFactor = balanceFactor(current);
481
482        if (bFactor > 1)
483        {
484            current = balanceFactor(current.Left) > 0
485                    ? rotateLeftLeft(current) : rotateLeftRight(current);
486        } else if (bFactor < -1)
487        {
488            current = balanceFactor(current.Right) > 0
489                    ? rotateRightLeft(current) : rotateRightRight(current);
490        }
491
492        return current;
493    }
494
495    /**
496     * Delete the Node containing the {@code target}.
497     *
498     * @param current  the current Node
499     * @param target   the element to be deleted
500     * @param found    {@code true} if found
501     * @param balanced {@code true} if tree is to be kept balanced
502     *
503     * @return replacement parent Node
504     */
505    @SuppressWarnings("AssignmentToMethodParameter")
506    private Node<E> deleteNode(Node<E> current, E target, Ref<Boolean> found, boolean balanced)
507    {
508        Node<E> parent;
509
510        if (current != null)
511        {
512            //left subtree
513            if (target.compareTo(current.Value) < 0)
514            {
515                current.Left = deleteNode(current.Left, target, found, balanced);
516
517                if (balanced && balanceFactor(current) == -2)//here
518                {
519                    current = balanceFactor(current.Right) <= 0
520                            ? rotateRightRight(current) : rotateRightLeft(current);
521                }
522            } //right subtree
523            else if (target.compareTo(current.Value) > 0)
524            {
525                current.Right = deleteNode(current.Right, target, found, balanced);
526
527                if (balanced && balanceFactor(current) == 2)
528                {
529                    current = balanceFactor(current.Left) >= 0
530                            ? rotateLeftLeft(current) : rotateLeftRight(current);
531                }
532            } //if target is found
533            else
534            {
535                if (current.Right != null)
536                {
537                    //delete its in-order successor
538                    parent = current.Right;
539
540                    while (parent.Left != null)
541                    {
542                        parent = parent.Left;
543                    }
544
545                    current.Value = parent.Value;
546                    current.Right = deleteNode(current.Right, parent.Value, found, balanced);
547
548                    if (balanced && balanceFactor(current) == 2)//re-balancing
549                    {
550                        current = balanceFactor(current.Left) >= 0
551                                ? rotateLeftLeft(current) : rotateLeftRight(current);
552                    }
553                } else
554                {   //if current.left != null
555                    current = current.Left;
556                }
557
558                found.val = true;
559            }
560        }
561
562        return current;
563    }
564
565    /**
566     * Prepare string output of all items held, in order of sequencing.
567     *
568     * @param current current Node to work down from
569     *
570     * @return built string
571     */
572    private String displayInOrder(Node<E> current)
573    {
574        StringBuilder rtn = new StringBuilder();
575
576        if (current != null)
577        {
578            rtn.append(displayInOrder(current.Left));
579            rtn.append(current.Value).append(", ");
580            rtn.append(displayInOrder(current.Right));
581        }
582
583        return rtn.length() > 0 ? rtn.toString() : "";
584    }
585
586    /**
587     * Fill the array in proper sequence.
588     *
589     * @param current the current Node
590     * @param array   the array to file
591     * @param index   the current index into the array
592     */
593    @SuppressWarnings("ValueOfIncrementOrDecrementUsed")
594    private void fillArray(Node<E> current, Object[] array, Ref<Integer> index)
595    {
596        if (current != null)
597        {
598            fillArray(current.Left, array, index);
599            array[index.val++] = current.Value;
600            fillArray(current.Right, array, index);
601        }
602    }
603
604    /**
605     * Finds the specified key.
606     *
607     * @param key the key to search for
608     *
609     * @return the {@linkplain Node}{@literal <T>} if found, or {@code null}
610     *         otherwise
611     */
612    private Node<E> find(E key)
613    {
614        Node<E> rtn = null;
615
616        if (key != null)
617        {
618            var node = findRecursive(key, root);
619            rtn = node != null && node.Value.equals(key) ? node : null;
620        } else
621        {
622            throw new NullPointerException(NO_NULLS);
623        }
624
625        return rtn;
626    }
627
628    /**
629     * Recursively search for the Node at the {@code index}.
630     *
631     * @param index   the index we are searching for
632     * @param current the current Node to check
633     *
634     * @return the Node if found, otherwise {@code null}
635     */
636    private Node<E> findIndexRecursive(int index, Node<E> current)
637    {
638        Node<E> rtn = null;
639
640        if (current != null)
641        {
642            if (index == current.Index)
643            {
644                rtn = current;
645            } else
646            {
647                rtn = findIndexRecursive(index, index < current.Index
648                        ? current.Left : current.Right);
649            }
650        }
651
652        return rtn;
653    }
654
655    /**
656     * Recursively find the {@code target} within the
657     * current Node's sub-tree.
658     *
659     * @param target  the target object being sought
660     * @param current the current Node
661     *
662     * @return the Node if found, otherwise {@code null}
663     */
664    private Node<E> findRecursive(E target, Node<E> current)
665    {
666        Node<E> rtn = null;
667
668        if (current != null)
669        {
670            if (target.equals(current.Value))
671            {
672                rtn = current;
673            } else
674            {
675                rtn = findRecursive(target, target.compareTo(current.Value) < 0
676                        ? current.Left : current.Right);
677            }
678        }
679
680        return rtn;
681    }
682
683    /**
684     * Get the height of the current Node.
685     *
686     * @param current the current Node
687     *
688     * @return the height
689     */
690    private int getHeight(Node<E> current)
691    {
692        // (BW) Changed to 'var'
693        int height = 0;
694
695        if (current != null)
696        {
697            int leftHeight = getHeight(current.Left);
698            int rightHeight = getHeight(current.Right);
699            int maxHeight = Math.max(leftHeight, rightHeight);
700            height = maxHeight + 1;
701        }
702
703        return height;
704    }
705
706    /**
707     * Gets the Node at {@code index}.
708     *
709     * @param index the index to search for
710     *
711     * @return the Node if found, {@code null} otherwise
712     */
713    private Node<E> getNodeAt(int index)
714    {
715        if (index < 0 || index >= count)
716        {
717            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("index: " + index);
718        }
719
720        reIndex();
721        return findIndexRecursive(index, root);
722    }
723
724    /**
725     * Get the root Node.
726     *
727     * @return the root Node
728     */
729    private Node<E> getRoot()
730    {
731        return root;
732    }
733
734    /**
735     * Set the root Node.
736     *
737     * @param root the replacement Node
738     */
739    private void setRoot(Node<E> root)
740    {
741        this.root = root;
742    }
743
744    /**
745     * Gets a value indicating whether [index is dirty].
746     *
747     * @return {@code true} if the internal index is dirty.
748     */
749    private boolean indexIsDirty()
750    {
751        return lastIndexVersion != version;
752    }
753
754    /**
755     * Recursively index the nodes.
756     *
757     * @param current the current Node
758     * @param index   the current index value
759     */
760    @SuppressWarnings("ValueOfIncrementOrDecrementUsed")
761    private void indexRecursively(Node<E> current, Ref<Integer> index)
762    {
763        if (current != null)
764        {
765            indexRecursively(current.Left, index);
766            current.Index = ++index.val;
767            indexRecursively(current.Right, index);
768        }
769    }
770
771    /**
772     * This is used to add an {@code item } to the tree.
773     * <p>
774     * The reason it has been pulled out of the public method, is to allow
775     * constructor access
776     * to it, as the public method is a virtual one.
777     * </p>
778     *
779     * @param item the item to add
780     *
781     * @return {@code true } if successful, {@code false } otherwise
782     */
783    private boolean internalAdd(E item)
784    {
785        Ref<Boolean> rtn = Ref.val(false);
786
787        Node<E> newItem = new Node<>(Objects.requireNonNull(item, NO_NULLS));
788
789        if (root == null)
790        {
791            root = newItem;
792            rtn.val = true;
793        } else
794        {
795            root = addRecursive(root, newItem, rtn);
796        }
797
798        if (rtn.val)
799        {
800            count++;
801            version++;
802        }
803
804        return rtn.val;
805    }
806
807    /**
808     * Re-index the tree.
809     */
810    private void reIndex()
811    {
812        Ref<Integer> index = Ref.val(-1);
813
814        if (count > 0 && indexIsDirty())
815        {
816            indexRecursively(root, index);
817            lastIndexVersion = version;
818
819            if (index.val != count - 1)
820            {
821                throw new ReindexFailedException(
822                        "Re-indexing has failed: count(" + count + "), index("
823                        + index + ")");
824            }
825        }
826    }
827
828    /**
829     * Rotate sub-tree Left-Left
830     *
831     * @param parent the parent Node.
832     *
833     * @return the pivot Node.
834     */
835    private Node<E> rotateLeftLeft(Node<E> parent)
836    {
837        Node<E> pivot = parent.Left;
838        parent.Left = pivot.Right;
839        pivot.Right = parent;
840
841        return pivot;
842    }
843
844    /**
845     * Rotate sub-tree Left-Right
846     *
847     * @param parent the parent Node.
848     *
849     * @return the pivot Node.
850     */
851    private Node<E> rotateLeftRight(Node<E> parent)
852    {
853        Node<E> pivot = parent.Left;
854        parent.Left = rotateRightRight(pivot);
855
856        return rotateLeftLeft(parent);
857    }
858
859    /**
860     * Rotate sub-tree Right-Left
861     *
862     * @param parent the parent Node.
863     *
864     * @return the pivot Node.
865     */
866    private Node<E> rotateRightLeft(Node<E> parent)
867    {
868        Node<E> pivot = parent.Right;
869        parent.Right = rotateLeftLeft(pivot);
870
871        return rotateRightRight(parent);
872    }
873
874    /**
875     * Rotate sub-tree Right-Right
876     *
877     * @param parent the parent Node.
878     *
879     * @return the pivot Node.
880     */
881    private Node<E> rotateRightRight(Node<E> parent)
882    {
883        Node<E> pivot = parent.Right;
884        parent.Right = pivot.Left;
885        pivot.Left = parent;
886
887        return pivot;
888    }
889
890    /**
891     * This is a descending iterator.
892     *
893     * @param <T> type of the elements
894     */
895    private class ATDescItor<T> extends ATItor<T>
896    {
897
898        /**
899         * Instantiates a new ATDescItor object.
900         */
901        private ATDescItor()
902        {
903            super();
904            position = size();
905        }
906
907        @Override
908        public boolean hasNext()
909        {
910            return isExpectedVersion() && position > 0;
911        }
912
913        @Override
914        @SuppressWarnings(
915                {
916                    "unchecked", "ValueOfIncrementOrDecrementUsed"
917                })
918        public T next()
919        {
920            if (!isExpectedVersion())
921            {
922                throw new ConcurrentModificationException(CONCURRENT_MODIFICATION_EXCEPTION);
923            }
924
925            if (--position < 0)
926            {
927                throw new NoSuchElementException();
928            }
929
930            lastReturned = (T) get(position);
931            return lastReturned;
932        }
933    }
934
935    /**
936     * This is an ascending iterator.
937     *
938     * @param <T> type of the elements
939     */
940    private class ATItor<T> implements Iterator<T>
941    {
942
943        /**
944         * String to display when there is a ConcurrentModificationException.
945         */
946        protected static final String CONCURRENT_MODIFICATION_EXCEPTION
947                = "Another thread has modified the data structure";
948
949        /**
950         * The expected version number.
951         */
952        protected int expectedVersion;
953
954        /**
955         * The last entry returned.
956         */
957        protected T lastReturned;
958
959        /**
960         * The current position within the list.
961         */
962        protected int position;
963
964        /**
965         * Instantiates a new ATItor object.
966         */
967        private ATItor()
968        {
969            position = -1;
970            expectedVersion = version;
971            lastReturned = null;
972        }
973
974        @Override
975        public boolean hasNext()
976        {
977            return isExpectedVersion() && position < count - 1;
978        }
979
980        @Override
981        @SuppressWarnings(
982                {
983                    "unchecked", "ValueOfIncrementOrDecrementUsed"
984                })
985        public T next()
986        {
987            if (!isExpectedVersion())
988            {
989                throw new ConcurrentModificationException(CONCURRENT_MODIFICATION_EXCEPTION);
990            }
991
992            if (++position == count)
993            {
994                throw new NoSuchElementException();
995            }
996
997            lastReturned = (T) get(position);
998            return lastReturned;
999        }
1000
1001        @Override
1002        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1003        public void remove()
1004        {
1005            if (!isExpectedVersion())
1006            {
1007                throw new ConcurrentModificationException(CONCURRENT_MODIFICATION_EXCEPTION);
1008            }
1009
1010            if (lastReturned == null)
1011            {
1012                throw new IllegalStateException();
1013            }
1014
1015            delete((E) lastReturned);
1016            lastReturned = null;
1017            expectedVersion = version;
1018        }
1019
1020        /**
1021         * Is the current version what we expect?
1022         *
1023         * @return result
1024         */
1025        protected boolean isExpectedVersion()
1026        {
1027            return expectedVersion == version;
1028        }
1029    }
1030
1031    /**
1032     * Stores a value/item in the BST.
1033     *
1034     * @param <T> element type
1035     */
1036    @SuppressWarnings("ProtectedField")
1037    private final class Node<T>
1038    {
1039
1040        /**
1041         * List index position of this Node.
1042         */
1043        public int Index;
1044
1045        /**
1046         * The attached Left child Node.
1047         */
1048        public Node<T> Left;
1049
1050        /**
1051         * The attached Right child Node.
1052         */
1053        public Node<T> Right;
1054
1055        /**
1056         * The value/item being stored in this Node.
1057         */
1058        public T Value;
1059
1060        /**
1061         * Initialize a new instance of the {@link Node Node&lt;E&gt;} class.
1062         *
1063         * @param value to store in this Node.
1064         */
1065        private Node(T value)
1066        {
1067            this.Value = value;
1068        }
1069    }
1070}
